page.title: 01CHESTERTON AND SIDDINGTON
page.content: Chesterton is a residential suburb to the south of Cirencester.It stands 400 ft.above sea level,the land slopes gently away to the south.Built mainly since the end of World War 2,at first by the Council and then by private development,the third phase is still under construction and is planned to eat into 60 acres of farmland in the SW in the near future. Mixed arable farming is carried on in the area. Parts of 7 such are in this block. To the east is a small industrial estate of firms which serve the engineering, building,home improvement & transport industries.To the east of this is the village of Siddington joined to Cirencester by a short stretch of ribbon development.Here are to be found the usual village buildings, church,school and pub.
